newsitem.title: CHINA: Erdos new B shares debut weak.
newsitem.headline: Erdos new B shares debut weak.

text.p: Inner Mongolia Erdos Cashmere Products Co Ltd's 100 million additional B shares debuted down on Friday compared to the Thursday closing price because of unfavourable market sentiment, brokers said.

The shares of the world's biggest cashmere producer, issued at $0.83 per share, opened at $0.894 compared with Thursday's close of $0.916. They then fell further on profit-taking to end the morning session at $0.838, they said.

"The performance of Erdos' new shares is unsatisfactory," said one broker. "After yesterday's market falls, investor confidence has been seriously hurt and they are reluctant to hold Erdos given its already high price."

Shanghai's B shares ended Thursday down 5.592 points, or 6.34 percent, to 82.583 after Beijing imposed new curbs on the trading of shares by state-owned companies, barring them from making "speculative" deals.
"Some institutions have recently pushed the Erdos price to a high level to prepare for the listing, providing space for profit-taking under current weak conditions," another broker said.
